frameDefinitions: A Protester (or Protesters) expresses a strong opinion either in support of or against an Issue, or the Action(s) of a Side which relate to the Issue.
The  Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
An Agent, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some Patient in some Situation.
A Supporter assists to strengthen the Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).
An Agent or a Cause causes a Fluid to move from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.
A Cognizer has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an Issue.
frameExamples: Several hundred Tibetans, already worried by inflation, took to the streets to <t>protest</t> at the new measures.
Mr Smithers always <t>encourages</t> the employees to stay late and work harder.
The fireballing righthander looked poised to <t>dominate</t> the Yankees yet again, striking out seven straight batters during one stretch
The bottom of the wall is <t>supported</t> by the foundation.
In interviews , it seems like everyone is completely <t>against</t> this expenditure .
listRoleDefinitions: The individual (or individuals) who holds an opinion on an Issue or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Protester</fen> has an positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Protester</fen> sides with.
An action taken by a Side or a view that the Side takes on an issue which the <fen>Protester</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the Protesters express their opinions.
The location where the <fen>Protester</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
What the communication is about.
The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the <fen>Addressee</fen> towards the <fen>Content</fen>.
An entity which the <fen>Speaker</fen> believes should participate in the action.
The time at which the lobbying occurs.
The location where the <fen>Speaker</fen> attemtps susaion on an <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time when the domination takes place.
The place where the domination occurs.
The <fen>Supporter</fen> acts to benefit the <fex name='Supported'>Supported</fex> by providing additional strength or stability.
The <fen>Supported</fen> is given strength through the assistance of the <fen>Supporter</fen>.
This role identifies when the support occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the support occurs.
The animate protagonist who causes the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.
An event or force that causes the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.
The entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way. It is not necessarily in a liquid state but is construed that way.
The location that the <fen>Fluid</fen> occupies initially.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> ends up in as a result  of the motion
The trajectory along which the Fluid moves, exclusive of the <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen>.
The setting in which the <fen>Fluid</fen>'s movement takes place along an unspecified <fen>Path</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the fluidic motion event is caused.
The location where the motion takes place.
The individual that holds an opinion on an <fen>Issue</fen> or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an opinion about.
An action taken by a <fen>Side</fen> or a view that the <fen>Side</fen> takes on an issue which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the indicated point of view towards the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
listRoleExamples: On 8 May a <fex>student</fex> demonstration was attended by a large number of workers.
Hundreds gathered this afternoon to demonsrate <fex>for women's rights</fex>.
Violent protests <fex>against the government</fex> are sure to break out.
Several hundred Tibetans, already worried by inflation, took to the streets to protest <fex>at the new measures</fex>.
Their role models might have dominated women <fex>in the past</fex>; they may not have understood the concept of equality.
Women tend to dominatemen <fex>at home and at Church</fex>.
<fex>Early in the twentieth century</fex>, such economic arguments buttressed the creation of a National Park Service.
<fex>In England</fex>, economic incentives are buttressed by closing certain overdoctored areas from new practices.
What happens if <fex>we</fex> drip acid on this compound?
Why did  you squirt juice <fex>onto my chair</fex>?
I spattered the egg all over the floor <fex>in the kitchen</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> she opposed the bill, but changed her mind after she received correspondence supporting the bill.
